articles.author: Ganesh Dahal
articles.description:
Global styles, a feature of the block themes, is one of my favorite parts of creating block themes. The concept of global style variations in WordPress were introduced in Gutenberg 12.5 which would allow theme authors to create alternate â€¦
Creating Style Variations in WordPress Block Themes originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Creating Style Variations in WordPress Block Themes

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
In my last article we saw how CSS background properties allow us to create cool hover effects. This time, we will focus on the CSS text-shadow property to explore even more interesting hovers. You are probably wondering how adding shadow â€¦
Cool Hover Effects That Use CSS Text Shadow originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Cool Hover Effects That Use CSS Text Shadow

articles.author: Jhey Tompkins
articles.description:
Braydon Coyer recently launched a monthly CSS art challenge. He actually had reached out to me about donating a copy of my book Move Things with CSS to use as a prize for the winner of the challenge â€” â€¦
A CSS Slinky in 3D? Challenge Accepted! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: A CSS Slinky in 3D? Challenge Accepted!

articles.author: Ollie Williams
articles.description:
According to Toshi Omagari, the author of Arcade Game Typography, the worldâ€™s first multi-colored digital font was created in 1982 for a never-released video game called Insector. Multi-colored fonts, sometimes called chromatic type, are still relatively rare on the â€¦
COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: COLRv1 and CSS font-palette: Web Typography Gets Colorful

articles.author: Md Shuvo
articles.description:
By now, you are probably familiar with one or more programming languages. But have you ever wondered how you could create your own programming language? And by that, I mean:
A programming language is any set of rules that convert 
â€¦
Letâ€™s Create a Tiny Programming Language originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Letâ€™s Create a Tiny Programming Language

articles.author: Sunkanmi Fafowora
articles.description:
AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image file format specification for storing images that offer a much more significant file reduction when compared to other formats like JPG, JPEG, PNG, and WebP. Version 1.0.0 of the AVIF specification â€¦
Useful Tools for Creating AVIF Images originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Useful Tools for Creating AVIF Images

articles.author: John Siciliano
articles.description:
Letâ€™s say you have a website built on a platform that excels at design and itâ€™s available at example.com. But that platform falls short at blogging. So you think to yourself, â€œWhat if I could use a different blogging â€¦
How to Serve a Subdomain as a Subdirectory originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: How to Serve a Subdomain as a Subdirectory

articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
So, youâ€™ve decided to build a blog with Next.js. Like any dev blogger, youâ€™d like to have code snippets in your posts that are formatted nicely with syntax highlighting. Perhaps you also want to display line numbers in the â€¦
Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Syntax Highlighting (and More!) With Prism on a Static Site

articles.author: Nick Sypteras
articles.description:
If youâ€™ve spent time looking at open-source repos onÂ GitHub, youâ€™ve probably noticed that most of them use badges in their README files.Â Take the official React repository,Â for instance.Â There are GitHub badges all over theÂ READMEÂ file thatÂ communicate important dynamic info,Â like the latest released â€¦
Adding Custom GitHub Badges to Your Repo originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Adding Custom GitHub Badges to Your Repo

articles.author: Preethi
articles.description:
In design, reflections are stylized mirror images of objects. Even though they are not as popular as shadows, they have their moments â€” just think about the first time you explored the different font formats in MS Word or PowerPoint: â€¦
Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Creating Realistic Reflections With CSS

articles.author: Jhey Tompkins
articles.description:
Howdy yâ€™all! Unless youâ€™ve been living under a rock (and maybe even then), youâ€™ve undoubtedly heard the news that CSS-Tricks, was acquired by DigitalOcean. Congratulations to everyone! ğŸ¥³
As a little hurrah to commemorate the occasion, I wanted to â€¦
Creating the DigitalOcean Logo in 3D With CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Creating the DigitalOcean Logo in 3D With CSS

articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
In my last article, we went over how to set up a web app that serves chunks and bundles of CSS and JavaScript from CloudFront. We integrated it into Vite so that when the app runs in a browser, â€¦
Setting Up CloudFront to Host Your Web App originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Setting Up CloudFront to Host Your Web App

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
A while ago, Geoff wrote an article about a cool hover effect. The effect relies on a combination of CSS pseudo-elements, transforms, and transitions. A lot of comments have shown that the same effect can be done using background â€¦
Cool Hover Effects That Use Background Properties originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Cool Hover Effects That Use Background Properties

articles.author: Dan Christofi
articles.description:
When creating a component-based, front-end infrastructure, one of the biggest pain points Iâ€™ve personally encountered is making components that are both reusable and responsive when there are nested components within components.
Take the following â€œcall to actionâ€ (<CTA />â€¦
Avoiding the Pitfalls of Nested Components in a Design System originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Avoiding the Pitfalls of Nested Components in a Design System

articles.author: Mark Noonan
articles.description:
Automated front-end tests are awesome. We can write a test with code to visit a page â€” or load up just a single component â€” and have that test code click on things or type text like a user would, â€¦
Writing Strong Front-end Test Element Locators originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Writing Strong Front-end Test Element Locators
